creditline: Lent by the Jon Straub Family
description: porous red lacquered scabbard with bronze point and black lacquer ring at other end
medium: Steel, lacquered wood scabbard, metal fittings and wood hilt
text: Tanto_ were shorter daggers, usually 12-13 inches long, for hand-to-hand combat. They were usually fashioned to accompany tachi or katana swords, and were often decorated as matching sets. The distinctive tempering pattern of this example suggests that it was produced by the sword smith Toshizane of the Hamabe school in Inaba province (present-day Tottori prefecture).
